name: Federation of European Publishers
goal: The Federation of European Publishers represents 28 national associations of book publishers of the European Union and of the European Economic Area. Thus, FEP is the voice of the great majority of publishers in Europe. It acts in the name of publishers in the discussions and negotiations with the European Institutions concerning mostly the copyright legislation, information society, taxation and culture.
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Communication, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Culture, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Enterprise, Environment, Home Affairs, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Research and Technology, Taxation, Trade, Youth
euInitiatives: Initiatives in the field of taxation (direct and indirect), in the field of e-commerce including on interoperability, in the field of intellectual property rights, in the field of freedom of expression and in the field of culture.
